website_summaries.verdict: A small and easy-to-use radar gun for multiple purposes.
pros: Small and portable, weighing only 4.5 ounces
Easy to bring wherever you need it
Great for traffic safety, industrial safety, scientific research, and more
Just point and hold down the button to use
cons: Not made to track speed of ball sports

customer_reviews.title: Works on RC planes too!  Must have in your RC goodies bag!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to see how fast my RC planes fly. Customer service confirmed it works on RC planes, so I got one. Works as advertised. Very happy with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Steiger

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, accurate unit
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a "low end" radar gun .. but the actual "gun shaped" units in my price range didn't seem to pass muster. This cost a bit more, but is *much* more compact and *very* efficient on battery life (uses two AA cells) I bought a tuning fork (direct from the manufacturer) and it shows my unit to be dead on at 65 mph. I am very happy with my purchase. Note: this is *not* a radar for measuring things like baseball pitches .. they have a different unit especially for that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Amirault

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Reslly helps stop the speeders on my block. The police are too busy at the donut shop
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Solid pocket radar
customer_reviews.text: This is as good of a pocket radar that you can get. It reads well and is easy to use. Sometimes it misses the mark so you need to make sure your lines up properly. Prickly what it is but every good coach should have one
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Gual

customer_reviews.title: Inconspicuous and accurate for softball
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for measuring the speed of my daughters pitch in softball (12" balls). The results are consistent and fairly accurate. I've been very impressed with this. My only complaint is that you need to get the timing right to take the reading of a pitch. There was someone on here who complained about the accuracy compared to their car, car speedometers can be off by as much as 10% even when new so I would take a speedometer reading with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Pictor

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate and is so small it is very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I coach softball and this is so easy to use, carry around, etc. It seems very accurate and the batteries have lasted a long time. I also play baseball and have had friends clock me and it seems accurate for that, too (though I wish I could throw a few mph faster!). It takes a few practice throws to get used to when to time pressing the button but that's not a problem, you just need to read the directions and follow them....Press the button as the pitcher's arm begins coming forward, NOT as they release the ball.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Excellant
customer_reviews.text: Read a few reviews about mis-reads. I'm gonna say 1 in about 30 are bad, not enough to take a star away. Works great and fits in the palm of your hand. I've been using it for a couple of months now, probably 30 or 40 times for an hour each time and the batteries are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Phalwa

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar Works Extremely Well
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding device. We're using it to record speeders on our street and registering excessive speeds with local police as a basis for requesting more active speed monitoring/ticketing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a have to have item for a dad of a softball pitcher
customer_reviews.text: If your daughter pitches you understand that statement and probably are trying to decide between this and other radar guns. I recommend this one over the $100.00 less Bushnell gun. It works well and looks like a cell phone. I didn't have good luck with the two Bushnell's I purchased online.
customer_reviews.author: peariver

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very accurate .
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite toy ! I use it primarily to monitor the speed of cars in my neighborhood for fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Discreet and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've run it next to a couple of the big, gun-style radars and it's typically within one mile an hour, give or take. Discreetly radar your pitchers (or others) so as not to mess with them. Easily fits in your pocket. About the same footprint as my smart phone, though a little thicker. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LC's Dad

customer_reviews.title: which is great for carrying around
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our pitching lessons. Took a minute to figure out how to use. Face screen to your face when catching. Its really compact, which is great for carrying around, and seems right on as far as accuracy. Excited about this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little radar
customer_reviews.text: I have been a police radar instructor trainer for some 45 years. This instrument is the ideal sports radar (my grandson is learning to be a baseball pitcher), pocket sized, and every bit as accurate as the bulky radar units. I have compared simultaneous readings between the Pocket Radar and a police radar unit. Both displayed the same reading. The stated accuracy of +/- 1 MPH is spot on. I highly recommend this to any sport coach.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great product as advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Very small and discreet so pitchers and fans can't even tell you are checking pitching speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Brad E

customer_reviews.title: works ver well
customer_reviews.text: I coach pitching for a travellball team and this is proving to be a very consistent and a convenient way to get my pitchers competing against themselves, instead of each other. They are throwing harder as a result, so it is not only functional, but effective at improving player effort.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: catch those speeders in your community
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to capture speeders through our condo community. Works well. I suggest recording it with a phone/camera. Hold down the button for pulsing real-time speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great Coaches gift
customer_reviews.text: accurate. Great Coaches gift! we have used it often. Everybody loves it when they see it, too. fits in pocket. At a baseball tournament a coach from another team came up and was clocking my sons speed with his "Professional scouting radar gun" and he was getting the same reading as I was, but his was big and obvious. I can discreetly go up to his son's game and clock his pitch speed and no one would notice.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: I simply love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I simply love this thing. Many times smaller and lighter than my Stalker Sport, and almost as good on range. Accuracy is great. Rember if it is too big to carry, you will just leave it home. This is about the size of a cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff K.

customer_reviews.title: Great when straight
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very satisfied with the product. It's easy to use and very accurate. Only drawback is you have to be directly behind or in front of the target. I use it for baseball and am constantly move side-to-side to pick up speed of pitch depending on where the batter is facing. Timing is everything and is relatively easy once you get the hang of when to release the button. Frustating at times when you pick up the bat speed opposed to the pitch due to releasing the button late. Again, overall it's a great, accurate, and extremely portable device. It's so small, most people think it's my cell phone and not a radar.
customer_reviews.author: bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Good Radar Gun
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, and seems accurate with the limited testing I have done. If you are using for many readings one after another, at times it will not fire, and you have to let it shut off then start again.
customer_reviews.author: Banmo

customer_reviews.title: Unique radar tool
customer_reviews.text: This unit is excellent because of it's accuracy, compactness, and ability to go anywhere, any time. It can be used virtually any place, and on virtually any moving object.
customer_reviews.author: SPC

customer_reviews.title: Smallest radar gun ever!
customer_reviews.text: This radar gun a K-band radar gun. I use it for making a aim-and-shoot game simulator with a used radar detector. It works perfectly and the beam is narrow enough (within 5 degree) and strong enough in a 2,000 feet range. It also good for measure the speed effectively within 1000 feet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Yu

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a great product. It does take a little practice to learn how to trigger it at the right time for pitching, and I still miss some measurements, but it's not a big problem. I haven't had a chance to compare it side by side with an expensive, recently calibrated radar gun, but the readings I get in the car agree very closely with the speedometer. As near as I can tell, it really is within 1 mph, which is plenty good for my purposes. For the price, and size, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Steven stanners

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the greatest thing a baseball players parent could have. I use this to help my son figure out the proper speeds to throw different pitches, and to measure his bat speed improvement. Can not say enough good things about the pocket radar. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to find out if my little leaguer is throwing with only his arm, or whole body. It is really a better feedback tool than the elusive "pop" of the catcher's mitt.
customer_reviews.author: Marc A. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: DOA unit - need to return
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. We would like to return for a replacement. Jen Blink
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for monitoring speeders in the neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I've tested it against the speedometer in my car and it always measures the same as the speedometer or within one mile-per-hour of it. I use it in connection with a homeowners association and monitoring speeding in the neighborhood. Excellent for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar....affordable, accurate, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: extremely accurate, verifiable by shooting fixed object while traveling at constant speed in your car. Will shoot through backstop fencing at angles of up to 10 degrees. Timing of the "press/release" of the red button takes some practice, but is not difficult. My daughter got it down in a matter of minutes while shooting my grandson pitching in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Spain

customer_reviews.title: It is accurate and reads speeds well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the pocket radar. It is easy to use and seems to record speeds very accurately. The only reason why I don't give it 5 stars is because you have to be very accurate with your timing when trying to read speeds. I love the product though and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: diemaucas

customer_reviews.title: It works great; just need to find a purpose in using ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great ; just need to find a purpose in using it! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: B. Negy Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Extremely accurate on cars. Didn't try it on anything else. Stealth: Small and non-threatening.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Great product with some minor inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. Minor nitpicks in that it will frequently pick up someones arm instead of the ball. It can also be a little tedious to time when to hold the button. You have to get it just right.
customer_reviews.author: William Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a volleyball coach and use this to measure the speed of serves and hits. Very compact, makes it easy to carry at practice!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar
customer_reviews.text: Being used in a New Zealand retirement village to log which vehicles are exceeding the speed limit of 15 kph. Unit appears to do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Philip H M Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Great for weekend tournaments
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take with us to weekend Softball tournaments. The small form factor is really nice, it's pretty easy to use and seems very accurate when compared to results from other radar guns.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Chancellor

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Speed Radar Update
customer_reviews.text: I have to update this review. I was contacted by the President of Pocket Radar, he sent me a new unit and this past weekend I used it at a baseball tournment. I am happy to report the unit worked fine, the readings were in line with other radar guns that were in use at the time. I am happy to report that I would recommend this product, and would like to thank the people at Pocket Radar for looking out for their customers and backing their product. NICE JOB !
customer_reviews.author: yankees1520

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Small, accurate, and easy to carry. I love this thing! People think you're pointing a camera they have no idea it's a radar.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lundy

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a much larger radar gun I use for coaching baseball with this unit and it is awesome. I have Compared this radar gun to other side by side for accuracy and it is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brinson

customer_reviews.title: Used it next to much more expensive guns, kept ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it next to much more expensive guns,kept right up as long as you can stay much closer.Be aware and use it right and it will do the job.Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My girls and I love using the pocket radar to clock their pitches. We have even started taking it to their games to clock them and their opponents and to their practices to help their teammates. Definitely worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: greg maddox

customer_reviews.title: pocket radar speed reading
customer_reviews.text: I pointed the pocket radar at my wall and read 15 mph. Couldn't get consistent reading. Wouldn't recommend this product. I had others try it to make sure it wasn't me. They had same problem. Pointed at a solid object and got readings! I would like to update my review. I was surprised to get a quick response from the president of pocket radar. He addressed a problem that I might be having and offered to give further help and if necessary a replacement. Customer service is surprising and very welcome. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: james blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Radar detector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he has been enjoying it checking the pitching speed of our select baseball team. Works fine through the chain link fencing behind the backstop.
customer_reviews.author: D. McConnell

customer_reviews.title: NIce Piece
customer_reviews.text: This thing is accurate. Compared it my GPS it is spot in.
customer_reviews.author: hdlefler

customer_reviews.title: This item more than met my expectaions.
customer_reviews.text: This item more than met my expectaions. Had a lot of speeders within our private park who denied it until we bought this pocket radar. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Alfreda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - Great Results
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Pocket Radar last week in time for a big 16U baseball tournament in Arizona Memorial Day Weekend. Every game had a Stalker Sport radar gun behind home plate, which start at $995. I did well over 100 tests side-by-side and the Pocket Radar was exactly the same 92% of the time. The times it was not the same, it was 1 mph more or less than the Stalker, never more than that. The Pocket Radar was very very easy to use and light weight. Plus the kids got a kick out of it attempting to radar everything as we drove home after the game!
customer_reviews.author: suds

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This thing kicks butt. Using it to test speeds of my vintage snowmobiles. Very accurate. Worth the money. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use speed radar gun. It is designed well and comes with a compact carrying case that is great to protect the device when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: BM1420

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar is a great tool for the team
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and accurate for measuring both pitching speed and bat speed. Reasonably priced for a high quality device!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: more difficult to use than expected
customer_reviews.text: My son was hoping the device could be used free-standing when he is alone in the basement taking hockey shots but it needs to be held, and it is somewhat tricky deciding when to start the radar for most accurate results. Mid-shot (or swing) is apparently best. There are suggestions in the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Small Radar
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little device. It works perfectly every time and is the topic of conversation at my flying field where I am using to time model jets and racers as speeds of 250 mph plus. Previously used bulky police radar gun. This is the size of a cell phone and just as accurate. A++++ on this purchase couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: C185Pilot

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: The product works perfectly. I always wanted to know how hard I could throw a baseball and it works amazing. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Tina J

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar
customer_reviews.text: The pocket radar is easy to use and you can get an accurate reading of pitching speeds. Recomend for any parent who has a child that pitches.
customer_reviews.author: Derick Gray

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised. It is small and weighs next to nothing! It is very accurate and even a monkey can operate it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sluckis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The pocket radar classic fullfilled my expectations, it works as I supposed it would, thanks
customer_reviews.author: Pedro J.

customer_reviews.title: Compact Speed Comparison
customer_reviews.text: This product has meet all may expectations. I can sit behind the backstop and analyze/scout other teams pitchers with stealth. It also allows us to give our pitchers feedback on their performance on the spot. I do recommend using beside a calibrated unit to know exactly where your readouts +/-mph are at.
customer_reviews.author: Dancolo

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar Personal Speed Radar Gun / Sports Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: This device works very well. It's not for all uses though as you'll need to be ~20-25 feet away to get a reading. I had hoped to use it in the garage over the winter, but it does not work as well there given space constraints. Outdoors, or in an indoor batting cages, the device works extremely well. The readings are consistent, if a couple mph slower than other guns.
customer_reviews.author: Victor H. Canseco

customer_reviews.title: Convinient, accurate and easy...
customer_reviews.text: Pocket Radar is pricey, no doubt! I had the speed gun and the iphone speed radar app. The pocket radar coviniently travels with without taking a lot of space. Compared to the speed gun, it is accurate for sure. Finally, it is easy to use without the bulkiness of the speed gun! I use it for softball pitching and sometimes you want to be alittle more conspicuous radaring other teams. If,its in your budget pocket radar is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pahl

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well for me had to return it. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: edward stalling

customer_reviews.title: good product, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It seems fairly accurate, simple to use and very convenient to carry in your pocket. I have not calibrated yet though. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Greg N.

customer_reviews.title: What a great radar gun we use it for baseball all the ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great radar gun we use it for baseball all the time. quick and easy to clock any pitcher
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smith

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent?
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use it while catching, and the measurements are different than if someone stands 10 feet behind me. I was hoping to be able to get an accurate read while catching for my pitchers.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Doorley

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: works as better than the expensive radar guns! I can stand back from the fence 10 foot and still get an accurate speed from a pitcher. just tap the red button at time of release and you get a reading within 1 mile an hour.
customer_reviews.author: pdb

customer_reviews.title: It's OK. I use it for baseball. You ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. I use it for baseball. You have to have it just right, or it doesn't pick up the speed. Takes a while to get use to it
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price. Use during live baseball games ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay for the price. Use during live baseball games. Doesnt pickup consistently, need to be close to field of play.
customer_reviews.author: David Wells

customer_reviews.title: pocket radar
customer_reviews.text: batteriesdo not last long , doesnt always register the speed correctly, you have to be directly behind the backstop or it doesnt work at all
customer_reviews.author: Frances Earnest

customer_reviews.title: A good tool, not a great one
customer_reviews.text: I have used the tool, but find it a little more difficult to get consistent accurate readings than I expected. I have been surprised at the narrow range of speeds between players that I anticipated would be greater. My error, machine error, or accurate, I don't know. Kids were thrilled with it at first, and less so now. Me too.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Strickland

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast to read (faster than the "pro" gun our pitching coach uses) and just as accurate. Its great to know what the girls will be facing before the enter into the box.
customer_reviews.author: Sliders Dad

customer_reviews.title: ok item
customer_reviews.text: This item is ok. A littler harder to use for swing speed than I expected. Does fine for pitching speed, if button pushed timely.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Streigle

customer_reviews.title: Where's the km/h?
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work, but I always thought I served faster than the speed indicates. No doubt this is a problem with me rather than the radar gun. Growing up in Australia and living in HK, though, I think in terms of km/h. Most countries have moved on from an antiquated measurement system based around yards and miles, and it would be nice if there was a switch for km/h.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: awesome little unit
customer_reviews.text: When this arrived in the mail I put the batteries in and started walking to the local park to try it out. On the way there I came across a police car doing speed checks on the access road. We ran checks between his laser unit and this one - all readings were either dead on or only 1MPH difference. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: its alright
customer_reviews.text: cant be used from the side, dosent help in the stands at the game. i dint want to be directly in front of my daughter in a game to check her speed.
customer_reviews.author: ray king

customer_reviews.title: Needs built in digital camera and download capabilities
customer_reviews.text: Using the Pocket Radar, I was pleasantly surprised to find that 90% of the people driving through our neighborhood drive within 5 MPH of the speed limit. However, I did clock a pizza delivery kid going 15 MPH over the speed limit. I wish the Pocket Radar had a digitial camera that could photograph an object as well as measure its speed. A picture of the speeding pizza delivery kid with his speed emblazoned on it sent to his boss might slow him down in the future. The device needs a built in digital camera and download capabilities. Otherwise, it is just an expensive toy.
customer_reviews.author: House Boy

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Radar Personal Speed Radar
customer_reviews.text: hi, i have your Pocket Radar Personal Speed Radar, and i am very dissapointed ! i am using this for tennis ball speed, and the messurements are for sure very very bad ! so about 15 to 20 miles per hour lower !!!! can i do something wrong ? but i do not think so ... is my device wrong ??? give me please any advice, thanks a lot. i am writing from czech republic thanks a lot jan bedan
customer_reviews.author: jan bedan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is perfect for identifying speeders going down the block.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great product works for 11U baseball throwing speed just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned when I opened the package and it had a card that said if I want to measure sports, to return the product and get the pocket radar for sports which is 100 bux more. I tried it with my son's pitching and it works just fine. Yes you have to time your pressing of the button, but it is really easy to figure that out. It works handy for capturing base running speed as well! This will be a handy tool to help my son work on his pitching speed!
customer_reviews.author: FAH924

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is off about 2 mph. Just add 2 to the total.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Foster

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item so that I can test the speed of my kids pitches and it works like a charm. I still can't get over how small and compact it is. Also the price is quite reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of finniky. It was a gift for dad and was hard for him to figure out. He didn't bother with it after a few high school games.
customer_reviews.author: Victorious

product_meta.title: Pocket Radar Classic Model / Speed Radar for Industrial and Traffic Uses
product_meta.description: Bulky and expensive radar guns are now a thing of the past. The Pocket Radar Classic model is a pocket-sized general purpose speed radar gun that can be used for many uses including traffic safety, radio controlled hobbies, motorsports, neighborhood safety, industrial safety, scientific research and much more. You decide what to measure and when, using one of two modes snapshot or repeating to accurately monitor the speeds of vehicles, radio controlled planes/cars, runners and any other moving object from 7-375 MPH (11-600 KPH). If you want to measure Ball Speeds then the Ball Coach radar is a better choice. Measures: 7 to 375 MPH (11 to 600 KPH), Accurate to within +/- 1 mph, it gives over 10,000 readings on a single set of batteries. Includes a hard-shell case, wrist strap, 2 AAA alkaline batteries, and an illustrated Quick Start Guide.
feature_bullets: NOT INTENDED TO MEASURE BALL SPEEDS. To accurately measure ball speeds, use the Smart Coach or Ball Coach models from Pocket Radar, also available on Amazon
Pocket Radar Classic model offers accurate speed radar in a convenient size for many uses including hobbies, traffic safety, industrial safety, neighborhood safety, scientific research and more
Manual one-button operation lets you decide what to measure and when
Easily and discreetly measure vehicle speeds, bicycle speeds, skating speeds, R/C speeds and running speeds
Small size of 2.3 by 4.7 by 0.8 inches (WxHxD) and only weighs 4.5 ounces with batteries. 10,000 readings on a single set of AAA batteries (included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars210 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
